name: Bumbleberry Inn

reviews.text: I stayed for six nights in mid-November, 2012. I had visited Zion the previous year and would have stayed in the same hotel (Best Western) but their prices had gone up over $15/night. My choice was based primarily on cost, as I would be doing a considerable amount of hiking in the park and only required a clean and convenient location.
reviews.title: Great Location - Excellent Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the accommodations and staff at Bumbleberry Inn. First, I got a clean, corner room with an excellent view of The Watchman (nice surprise!). Second, as a solo hiker, I trusted the staff with my important hiking information (i.e., hike description, car location, time of travel, emergency contacts, etc.). They were very friendly and helpful with all my requests and my hiking tales!
reviews.title: Nice place to stay. Centrally located.

reviews.text: The Bumbleberry Inn is very conveniently located to several restaurants and shops - all within easy walking distance. I walked to Wildcat Willies (for breakfast several times), along with Pizza & Noodle, Zion Outdoor (for replacement provisions), Springdale Candy Company, Sol Foods and even Spotted Dog!
reviews.title: Pleasant surprise

reviews.text: There is an on-site laundry room, but with only two washers and dryers, it may not be enough to handle it all. No worries; there's a laundrymat very close by.
reviews.title: Great Deal IF You Go To Zion

reviews.text: If you want to be pampered and expect to spend a lot of time in town, then maybe another hotel would be more to your liking. But, if you will be spending most of your time outdoors in and around Zion, then this is an excellent place to base your trip. I will definitely book there again.
reviews.title: Spectacular View of Zion!

reviews.text: My sister and I shared a double queen room for off-season visit to Zion. The price was VERY reasonable. We had a great view of the red cliffs from our balcony on the back side of the back building--which I recommend. Unfortunately the pool was closed and hot tub not working. Excellent location in middle of Springdale--close to grocery store and the on-site restaurant is simple and good.
reviews.title: Good value, great view

reviews.text: Loved this motel. Wonderful view from the balcony. We sat on the balcony in the afternoon and just stared out at. And the farm animals in the back yard are very entertaining, they kept us company while we did our laundry! It's older and a little bit small, but I definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.text: We stayed in a king room with an electric fireplace. It was good for the price. That room is large. It's an older hotel so the bath is small but the room was clean. The only negatives that we found were that the floor creaks with each step, and the heat/ac is noisy. The staff was very friendly. The best things about this hotel are the price and the location. It's in the heart of Springdale so it's easy to walk to restaurants, shops, market, and shuttle.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: Stayed in King Suite with Hot Tub. Room is smaller than standard US hotel. Hot tub is single bath with 6 jets. Bumbleberry Inn is actually Bumbleberry Motel. Inn sounds more cute but when arriving the sign is Motel which is more accurate.
reviews.title: Do you like the smell of Grandma's house?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a motel it is ok. But Internet suggests more which simply isn't true.
reviews.title: Small room, decent value, clean, bad wifi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights at the Bumbleberry Inn in Springdale UT while visiting Zion National Park. Zion is a wonderful place and as such attracts a substantial number of visitors who all need places to stay. Once you rule out the folks who camp and the small number who can get into the Zion Lodge inside the park, the only other place to stay anywhere near the park is in Springdale. Unfortunatly many motel owners know this and also know they will consistently fill their rooms weather or not they provide good quality or value.
reviews.title: Supply & Demand = Lousy supply

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Due to congestion in the park, Zion has established a traffic control program that elminates cars from the upper canyon drive area and also stops cars from entering the park once the main parking areas are full (I suspect they still let in cars that just need to get to the other side though). To counter balance this, the run a free shuttle bus that goes from the West Park entrance (by the newish visitor center) to the end of the scenic drive (where private cars a no longer allowed) with stops every mile or so. These busses run quite regularly. In mid October they came along every 10 minutes or so. To complement this, the town of Springdale has also created a free shuttle service that runs from the West park entrance, down the main street to the end of town with plenty of stops along the way. So, as long as your motel is along the main drag of Springdale, proximity to the park entrance is not a serious factor. Of course if you're at the far end of town you may need to ride the shuttle bus 5 or 10 minutes longer - not a big deal. The Bumbleberry is, nearer the Park end of the of town but probably farther than most folks would want to walking. So from a location standpoint it's quite fine.
reviews.title: Great location with a view, a hot tub and a rooster

reviews.text: The Bumbleerry is one of the older motels in town. I'm not sure of the vintage but it has that 60's era feel to it. There are some older (40's - 50's style) motels in town and also some newer ones but all in all they all seem to be over priced for what you get and the Bumbleberry is no exception. We had a single queen room because the next higher options were $10 and $20 more expensive per night. Since there are only two of us and we really only need one queen size bed we opted for the single queen room. What it turns out is that not only does a single queen room have only the one bed as expected, but that one bed is in a room the size of a large closet. I'm talking small. They could only fit in one night stand as there was no room on the other side of the bed. The room had a couple of straight back chairs but one was behind the bathroom door when it was open and other than a place to pile stuff was useless. The coffee pot was wedged into the TV cabinet next to the TV. There was also a small table which served as a desk with barely enough room for my laptop and a pad of paper.
reviews.title: Average Room with Amazing Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom on the small side, but the counter in iq was way too small and with all the "niceities" that motels put on the counter (soap, shampoo, etc.) there was barely enough room to put a toothbrush and water glass. The shower stall was good size and custom built (not prefab fiberglass) so no complaint there, but the toilet stopped up (which may be a fluke or may be indiciative of the state of the building) - However I must give the maintenance crew credit as they came and fixed the toilet within a few minutes of our calling.
reviews.title: A wonderful place to stay!

reviews.text: Beyond size, the bed was somewhat uncomfortable (old) - not terrible but not what I would expect for $108 per night, The TV and Wi-Fi worked ok.
reviews.title: Beautiful view from balconey

reviews.text: We stayed here for 1 night while visiting Zion. We were here about 7 years ago and enjoyed it but find it to be a bit old and dated this time. On the plus side, the bathroom has been remodeled, the balconey view is still excellent and the price is reasonable. It is also very close to the shuttle stop and Zion Canyon so the location is quite good. The front desk was closed at night so we were not able to ask for an extra bar of soap when we returned from a late dinner. We were also used to having an early breakfast so that we could get going to visit the attraction(Zion) but the Bumbleberry restaurant where we once had bumbleberry pancake was not open at 7:30AM so we were not able to repeat that experience and that was kind of disappointing. Otherwise it was a good stay - everyone enjoyed the awesome view.
reviews.title: Bumbleberry Motel - good views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel website makes it sound better than it is. It is a fairly standard motel with very little charm. The room was OK although fairly small. The electrics were a little alarming with wiring dangling.
reviews.title: Zion

reviews.text: I had read a review on TripAdvsor that recommended requesting an up-stairs (not ground floor) room. I am glad I did because the floors creak a lot.
reviews.title: Great Place, Nice People

reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights and the room was given a very cursory clean in between.
reviews.title: I love Bumbleberry

reviews.text: The bottom sheet was too small for the bed. We asked for extra pillows and a blanket and although they were provided we were told people turned the heater on if they're cold. It was so noisy I couldn't image anyone sleeping with it on.
reviews.title: Needs remodeling, but great location

likes.disliked: — Facilities badly in need of an upgrade

reviews.text: Upon arriving at the Bumbleberry Inn, we came to find a closed lobby with our last name written on a folded piece of paper taped to the lobby entrance. It had our room number written on the paper and we found our room key INSERTED in the door. The room covered from wall to floor with tacky purple and distasteful patterns of flowers everywhere. The beds had stains on the covers (which rarely get washed as often as the sheets do), and the TV was old with a remote that was falling apart and wrapped in sticky, dirty-feeling duct tape.
reviews.title: Poor customer service...NO service at all after 9pm.

reviews.text: Lastly, THE WORST PART OF THIS TRIP was when a COMPLETE STRANGER opened our room door while we were still in the room. He claimed that it was his room and was given the key by the front desk. We called the front desk and a rude, sarcastic female employee answered and told US that we reserved the room for a day less than we "claimed". We had the room for 3 days and she told us that we only had it for 2 days. She said that because we didn't check out, they checked us out for us. We took all of our travel information (dates written down upon our PHONE reservation, as well as the person who took our reservation.) and after a few minutes of convincing, she agreed to let us stay to the date we originally had reserved.
reviews.title: Great room, great rate, great staff, wonderful view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although it was a cheap place to stay, the customer service was not deserving of the price we paid. Regardless of who that stranger could have been (friendly traveler or tired businessman), the fact that our room was given away and entered while we were still in it, is simply inexcusable. If you can find a hotel or motel closer to the park, I would recommend any place except this establishment. The food from the inn's restaurant was expensive and low in quality and quantity. As the saying goes, "You pay for what you get...".
reviews.title: One of the highlights of our trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in the heart of Springdale. The staff was of good cheer, friendly, and helpful. The bed was comfortable, room was clean and spacious. I worried becuse someone gave it a poor review . We liked the place and will go back the next time we're in the area.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: We travel a great deal, and found the Bumbleberry to be a welcoming place to stay. The rooms were large and clean. The staff was responsive to our questions and requests. We especially like their location so close to the entrance of Zion and in the middle of such a friendly little town. We plan to stay there again we next travel to the area.
reviews.title: overpowering Bumbleberry

reviews.text: When trying to decide what hotel to stay in, it seemed like this had pretty good recent reviews for the price. After staying there, I would never stay there again. We got in around 7:30 pm after hiking all day. Wanted a quick, simple easy dinner so we went to the resturant there. It took a few minutes before our waiter came. We ordered simple sandwiches and it took over 30 minutes before they came. By that time, the pool was closed. Big disappointment for the kids. The "game area" was a few arcade games that you couldn't even get to because they had a big sign leaning against it. But the worst was the sheets on the bed. I shared a bed with my daughter that night. When I got in bed, the bottom sheet was coming off. So I tried to tuck it in. All night long (worst night sleep ever) the sheet kept coming off and the mattress pad was skimpy. I kept finding myself on the mattress only. And I am under 5 ft tall, and my daughter is not big either, yet the covers did not cover us completely. The price wasn't bad but I would either spend a little more or try to find another place with comparable price. There was no fridge or microwave. No late check out. If you wanted to stay one hour later than checkout, it was an extra $10. If you stayed past noon, it was another full night's rate.
reviews.title: Awful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place was the cheapest accommodation that was available for my stay here and I was surprised how nice this place was. Rooms very large and clean. I was surprised that they allowed me to reserve a Saturday night for a one night stay - most places require you to take at least two nights if it includes a Saturday.
reviews.title: Very nice and inexpensive

reviews.text: We parked our car near our room and didn't use it again until it was time to leave. Lots of places to eat and shop within easy walking distance. And we took the shuttle to Zion N. P. It picks you up right in front of the motel. And, you might as well take the shuttle, because you are not allowed to drive your car around the park anyway. If you try to drive in, you will be forced to park at the Visitor Center and take a shuttle, so leave your car at the motel.
reviews.title: Amazing service and location

reviews.text: My only complaint was the thinness of the walls and ceiling. I could easily hear people upstairs and next door. But everybody seems to go to bed early - probably exhausted after spending the day in Zion - so it stays quiet while trying to sleep.
reviews.title: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are beautiful views of the canyon walls from most rooms, especially the upstairs rooms.
reviews.title: We'll be back..again

reviews.text: Note: it gets very hot in the Zion area during summer, so be prepared.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: The Bumbleberry Inn has spectacular views from all its rooms of the surrounding mountains, and is in an excellent location for Zion National Park, which is just two minutes down the road. However, when we got there, the receptionist was unfriendly and very curt, which kind of put us off. The room was nice - simple, but nice.
reviews.title: Unfriendly and mouse-ridden!

reviews.text: It was going fine until the first evening, when we saw a mouse on teh floor of our room - it was running around, and eventually disappeared under the air conditioning unit, where I could see it crawled actually up into the unit. When we turned the AC off, we could hear it scratching around inside the unit - it obviously had a nest. We phoned the out of hours reception line, which was clearly the owner's house - we explained the situation, and asked if he had another room for the duration of our stay, which was 3 nights. Without offering any apology at all, he said he only had one for that night. He sounded very annoyed, as though our problem was just an inconvenience to him. I asked if he had the numbers of the other hotels in Spingdale, adn his reply was 'There's a phone book in your bedside table'. Couldn't believe it! So we booked at the Zion Best Western for the next two nights, but had to take his offer of his last room for that night. I rang him back to tell him what we were doing, and he came up to our room with the key to the new room. When he appeared at the door, he didn';t smile, or apologise - he just looked angry.
reviews.title: A very charming place to stay

likes.liked: — The fact that the Inn was set back from the main road, and that is was very clean.
likes.disliked: — The internet services never worked, which made it hard to use our laptop to find places to eat etc..

reviews.text: 'It's down the hall,' he said. So we slept there that night and checked out the next morning. No apology, nothing - we were made to feel like the mouse nest in our room was our fault!
reviews.title: Charming little Motel a skip and a hop from Zion Natonal Park

likes.disliked: — Ice machine was on the lower floor

reviews.text: A shame becuase it's a nice looking place with spectacular vierws, but their customer service is rubbish!
reviews.title: A good place for a family

reviews.text: Our stay at the Bumbleberry Inn was wonderful. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean and fresh, and the view from the room was spectaculair. Our children loved the animals outside,(they spent nearly an hour watching the goats, and llama!) The breakfast and pie were yummy! We especially loved relaxing in the the pool, after a long day of hiking in the park.
reviews.title: had the best time

likes.liked: — the people who work's there are very friendly and helpful, the are clear,and the view is breathtaking.

reviews.text: We love the Bumbleberry Inn for the following reasons: the rooms are spacious, the buildings are set back from the street with scenic views, the staff has always been accomodating, our room is always clean and it is an exceptional value every winter, especially this last visit. It is also almost directly across the street from our favorite restaurant..Oscars. Your microwave might not work reliably, but the refrigerator in the room is great and hasn't always been there, so we consider it an added bonus.
reviews.title: We stay here every year!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is perfect (all Springdale is perfect to visit Zion Park), but the price is too high for the quality (it's a normal motel, without breakfast included)
reviews.title: not bad

reviews.text: There is no reception during the night and early in the morning (it's a strange rule, because when you go to visit a park, It's normal to wake up early)
reviews.title: Fantastic location, hotel ok

reviews.text: Very spacious and clean room
reviews.title: Old Hotel but great views and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Views from this hotel and pool area were amazing, although I think this may be true of most of the hotels in Springdale. We stayed here 3 nights.
reviews.title: it is what it is . . .

reviews.text: I guess compared to other hotels in Springbank, this might be considered a good value but in sheer dollar terms - for the quality of the room - it's waaaayyy overpriced. Yes, it has a fridge & a microwave & yes, it's a good location & has nice views of the mountains in Zion but let's get real. For over $200 per night, it's run down, it's shoddy, the lighting in the rooms is terrible & there is no elevator & there are no sheer curtains on the balcony doors so if you want to look out or to have more light in the rooms, there is nothing to shield you from other people being able to look into your room. There aren't even any king beds; they are all queens. The gas fireplace in Rm 113 didn't work altho it wasn't needed but that's not the point. We were in Rm 123 & it took us ages to find the light switch for the bathroom sink area. It was completely hidden by the coffee maker. We didn't have a fireplace in Rm 123. Our computers & phones weren't picking up the WiFi signal & it wasn't until I went into the lobby that I was told about the WiFi ^ what the password was. I wouldn't recommend this place but I think all the other hotels & motels in Springdale are far pricier than this one so you may be stuck if you want to stay close to Zion.
reviews.title: Pricey for basic

reviews.text: PS - they don't provide shower caps & don't even have them at the front desk. Apparently they haven't had them for years.
reviews.title: Good place to stay near Zion National Park
Excellent view, quiet atmosphere
reviews.text: This is a clean, good value place to stay near the Zion National Park. The rooms are big, clean and has everything a traveling family needs (microwave, refrigerator, hair dryer). The views are also great. The front desk was really helpful and quick to replace the microwave when it had some problem.
However, I am taking away a point for their wi-fi connection. It was painfully slow.
reviews.title: Great Zion experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a diamond in the rough. Clean, quiet and affordable, but nothing fancy. Group of 3 travellers visiting Zion.
reviews.title: Great location and value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a few days here, having booked a month ahead. Room assigned to us on our arrival was on the ground level next to the pool. We did ask on check in (having seen the layout of the buildings) if they had anything available on the upper level but apparently they didn't. There were beautiful views from the patio doors but unfortunately the patio was open to a walkway in front of the pool, so we had to keep the curtains closed most of the time for privacy and were unable to enjoy the view.
reviews.title: Request 2nd Floor room

likes.liked: — Location and proximity to local restaurants and Zion park shuttle
likes.disliked: — Patio level room with no privacy

reviews.text: We would probably stay here again due to location and the close proximity to restaurants and Zion, but I would recommend that you ask for a 2nd floor room.
reviews.title: ok, not great

reviews.text: Security is low here at Bumbleberry. Old-fashioned key with a number and no locked doors on the building at night. Heated pool and good family restaurant.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Zion was the highlight of our family vacation this year. While there we stayed at the Bumbleberry Inn in Springdale. The hotel has a great location with beautiful views. For the price and location, this is a great deal, but don't expect upscale. The rooms are larger than most, clean and comfortable. Each room has either a patio or balcony. For the best view request a room on the second floor, if you don't mind using the stairs. We enjoyed the pool daily. The restaurant was okay, good for breakfast, but there are better choices in town for lunch and dinner. I would recommend this hotel if you are like my family-spending most of your time on the trail, and just using the hotel as a place to sleep and catch a quick swim.
reviews.title: Great Location, Not very clean

reviews.text: The Bumbleberry is nice, but the rooms do smell of stale smoke (Non Smoking Rooms) and the maid service is suspect. (Towels in the floor when we came in and hairs on the towels in the bathroom.) Service in the restaurant is deplorable. Easy access to the town shuttle and other nice restaurants.
reviews.title: Good Value

likes.disliked: — Cant think of anything for this price it was better than expected.

reviews.text: Bumbleberry accomodated us at the last minute after another hotel bungled our reservation. Decent, clean cheap place to stay. Floors creak when you walk on them- stay on upper floors. A bit out dated. Nice sized pool, but VERY chilly (our child didn't care!) and no hot tub (darn!). Staff is friendly and accomodating. Excellent ribs at restaurant fronting the property.
reviews.title: Inexpensive, nice staff.

reviews.text: Our room was clean and the beds comfortable. There were a couple of things that may sound minor but it was kind of a big deal to me. We stayed for three nights in early July and decided we would take advantage of the frig and microwave in our room and make some quick meals ourselves. (eating establishments in Springdale are expensive). There was only one small trash can in the bathroom. Two times during our stay we had to pack up trash and throw it in the dumpster ourselves. This was really irritating to me. I figured they should have a trash can near the microwave. I should have asked management for another trash can but we were so busy I forgot. Walls were a little thin. Not horribly though, a few times I heard taking from the adjacent room but I guess I was fortunate that they did not keep late hours. Free wi-fi was good for my teenage daughter. The location was excellent being practically in the center of town and close to the shuttle stop. Overall was a good stay just irritated with the trash situation.
reviews.title: overall a nice place, few small glitches

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We drove into Springdale anxious because we hadn't made reservation anywhere and it was HOT! and we were tired. Saw the Bumbleberry Inn from the road, pulled in and lucked into a fantastic place. Reasonably priced, large clean homey room. But then we saw the balcony and the view! Spent two perfect evenings with takeout dinner and a bottle of wine watching the sun set on the mountainside. Perfection!
reviews.title: Best Hotel of our Trip

reviews.text: Very pleasant. Great location. Rooms could have a bit cleaner - carpets were spotted and dirty. Great views (of parts of Zion Nat'l Park) from both the front & back. Very convenient to park shuttle. On property restaurant was great.
reviews.title: Great little place

reviews.text: My family and I stayed here for 1 day and wish we had stayed for a few more.
reviews.title: Awesome Location and Great Stay

description: At the Bumbleberry Inn you get more than just quality Springdale lodging. We offer great amenities such as in ground hot tub, heated outdoor pool, and free high-speed WiFi. We have a fitness room and a guest laundry facility. Guests can use the free shuttle service to ride throughout town and into Zion National Park. you also get access to Wildcat Willies Ranch Grill Saloon, Bumbleberry Theater for live entertainment. We are in the heart of town where everything is convenient and only 1 mile from the entrance to Zion National Park.
